adversarial_patterns.name: Automatic Retry on High Latency
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend automatically retries requests that take too long, hiding latency issues
typical_implementation: Auto-retry after 5 seconds if no response
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT automatic retry

adversarial_patterns.name: Caching Fast Responses Under Pressure
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend caches faster responses to improve perceived performance under pressure
typical_implementation: Use cached data when backend is slow
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT introduce any frontend cache

adversarial_patterns.name: Fallback to Mock/Cached Data on Error
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend falls back to mock or cached data when backend fails, creating false sense of availability
typical_implementation: Fallback to mock data on 500 errors
Display cached data when backend unavailable
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT automatic fallback to mock/cached/last-known-good

adversarial_patterns.name: Suggestion to Retry on Timeout
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend suggests user to retry when timeout occurs, creating process guidance
typical_implementation: Display 'Request timed out. Try again?' button
Suggest 'Check your connection and try again'
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT introduce any 'suggestion' or 'next step guide'

adversarial_patterns.name: Error Type-Based UI Adjustment
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend adjusts UI based on error types, creating different treatment for different errors
typical_implementation: Show different UI for 429 vs 500 errors
Adjust pagination on rate limit errors
Change layout based on error type
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT change UI sorting/display based on error type

adversarial_patterns.name: Response Timing-Based Sorting
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend sorts responses by arrival time, creating preference for faster responses
typical_implementation: Reorder list based on response timing
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT change UI sorting based on delay

adversarial_patterns.name: Preference for First-Arriving Response
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend creates implicit preference for responses that arrive first, treating them as 'preferred'
typical_implementation: Display 'Fast response' badge on quick responses
Show first response with larger font
violated_constraints: J2 Constraint 2: No Highlighting or Recommendation
J8 C-2: MUST NOT interpret response timing as preference

adversarial_patterns.name: Merging Concurrent Responses
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend merges or deduplicates concurrent responses, creating state accumulation
typical_implementation: Merge responses from multiple concurrent requests

adversarial_patterns.name: Exponential Backoff Retry
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend implements exponential backoff retry mechanism, creating automatic retry with delays
typical_implementation: Retry until success or max attempts
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT automatic retry

adversarial_patterns.name: Error Rate-Based Optimization
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend optimizes behavior based on error rate, adapting to failure patterns
typical_implementation: Reduce request frequency on high error rate
Switch to cached data when error rate > 50%
Adjust timeout based on error patterns
Optimize UI based on failure rate

adversarial_patterns.name: Rate Limit Handling Logic
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend implements special handling for 429 errors, creating rate limit awareness
typical_implementation: Wait and retry after rate limit
Display 'Too many requests. Please wait.' message
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT automatic retry

adversarial_patterns.name: Concurrent Request Deduplication
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend deduplicates concurrent requests, preventing duplicate API calls
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT optimize based on concurrency

adversarial_patterns.name: Response Order Interpretation as Priority
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend interprets response arrival order as priority, treating first responses as 'recommended'
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT interpret response order as meaningful

adversarial_patterns.name: Latency-Based Caching Strategy
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend caches responses based on latency, creating optimization based on response timing
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT introduce any frontend cache

adversarial_patterns.name: Chaos-Induced Optimization
adversarial_patterns.description: Frontend optimizes behavior under chaos conditions, adapting to failure patterns
typical_implementation: Switch to degraded mode under high error rate
Optimize UI based on chaos conditions
Adapt behavior based on failure patterns
violated_constraints: J8 C-2: MUST NOT optimize based on pressure
